nodes.bodyText:
There is no scope optional.
It's:
<optional>true</optional>

No idea why maven isn't fail fasting when you do this.
If you ran any tests from a client's perspective (say in optaplanner-examples) on JDK 11 they probably had rhino in the classpath...

Provided is incorrect here. That indicates that it will be there at runtime through the application container.
I 'd argue it should be scope runtime (no rhino imports) with optional>true<
Can we move this eyesore into the "impl" package? :)

nodes.bodyText:
Naming: "Support" is too generic.
How about "RhinoScriptEngineWorkaround" (RhinoScriptEngine is wrong, it doesn't extend ScriptEngine) or "RhinoJavaScriptPoolSizer"?

+package org.optaplanner.core.config.util;
+
+import java.util.function.IntSupplier;
+
+import org.mozilla.javascript.Context;
+import org.mozilla.javascript.ContextFactory;
+import org.mozilla.javascript.RhinoException;
+import org.mozilla.javascript.Scriptable;
+
+/**
+ * This class exists separately, as Rhino is an optional dependency and the imports would have immediately triggered
+ * {@link ClassNotFoundException}s if present on {@link ConfigUtils} directly.
+ */
+final class RhinoSupport implements IntSupplier {
